intro: Lueheopsis rugosa, commonly known as the roughleaf lueheopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
